Posts.Title: I'm back...... orlandpark1965 HLB

Posts.Content: Aug 17, 2012 12:46PM orlandpark1965 wrote: I just had someone tell me all about her neighbor that died from BC.  People do this all the time.  Just like when my mom died someone said " oh your going to miss her"  REALLY, didn't think of that.   The other day I FINALLY said to this girl on the train, " No offense, but don't want to hear about it".   I felt so much better that I FINALLY did that instead of listening and then being in a funk all day
Posts.Title: I know there's a "stupid things people say to you" thread but lanagraves sbelizabeth

Posts.Content: Aug 13, 2012 11:57AM orlandpark1965 wrote: Steph:   Beautiful and you are right on.  I think Im going to print this and re -read it when I need it. There is a song I listen to at least 3 times a day.  "Living in the moment" by Jason Mraz.   Such a good song and it's my therapy.

Posts.Title: moving on to stage IV orlandpark1965 Gitane

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2012 06:11PM orlandpark1965 wrote: Many: Thank you.  What a roller coaster.    My liver turned out to be "fatty" no cancer in the organs. The bone is still being looked at.   It could be the early stages of Padgets disease (not cancer) my mom had it but they are now sending me for a PET scan on Monday and see a Bone Oncologist on Tuesday.  I have tons of arthritis since my first scan.  My onc said that they will want a bone biopsy.   So I feel there is still hope and I have seeked some help from a local cancer support center and feeling better. If it's bone met's I'll just have to accept that.   How is your wife
Posts.Title: moving on to stage IV orlandpark1965 Gitane

Posts.Content: Jul 20, 2012 06:13PM orlandpark1965 wrote: Thank you everyone for the prayers.   I'm a big believer in prayer. I'll keep  you posted next week.   So I guess I'm still a stage 3.99 gal
